results.title: Mackenna's gold
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Carl Foreman, Dimitri Tiomkin and J Thompson
results.brief_description: A dying Indian entrusts sherrif Mackenna (Gregory Peck) with a map of the legendary Valley of Gold. After memorising the contents of the map Mackenna destroys it, thus placing himself in a precarious position of being a target to the local bandit gang as well as the townspeople. The two parties are united by a greed for gold and a fear of the common enemy, the Apaches. The gold in the canyon belongs to the Apaches and it has been decreed by Apache Gods that the gold remain untouched. Both those who are hunting the gold, and the Apaches who are protecting it have their own reasons behind desiring its possession, leading to a violent climax. Cast includes Gregory Peck, Omar Sharif, Telly Savalas, Burgess Meredith and Edward G Robinson. Also included on the tape are original theatrical trailers and behind the scenes information.

results.title: MAC and me
results.creator_credit: R J Louis Productions, R.J. Louis and Stewart Raffill
results.brief_description: Eric, a wheelchair bound boy who has just moved to California begins an unusual friendship with MAC (Mysterious Alien Creature) who has accidentally landed on earth and become separated from his family. Whilst escaping from NASA MAC takes refuge in Eric’s car and accompanies the family to their new home. Eric helps MAC rejoin his family and a strong friendship is formed. Starring Jonathan Ward, Tina Casparay, Lauren Stanley and Jade Calegory.

results.title: M*A*S*H = Mash (Special edition) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Aspen Productions, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Ingo Preminger, Leon Ericksen and Robert Altman
results.brief_description: Hailed as one of the best comedies ever made. Army surgeons during the Korean war develop a lunatic life-style in order to cope with the everyday horrors encountered in a Mobile Army Surgical Hospital. The film mixes slap-stick with tragedy and pokes merciless fun at military pomposity, empty religion and incompetence. It sticks its tongue out at hypocrisy - the same attitudes which made the spin-off television series highly successful. Based on a novel by Richard Hooker.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Aspen Productions, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Ingo Preminger, Leon Ericksen and Robert Altman

results.title: Lust in the dust
results.creator_credit: Fox Run Productions, New World Pictures, Alan Glaser, Tab Hunter and Paul Bartel
results.brief_description: This camp, affectionate spoof of B western films, features drag-queen and cult-movie star Divine (1945-1988) best known for her performances in the films of John Waters. Basically a series of comedy skits that draw heavily on stereotypes of the western genre, the plot revolves around a group of mis-assorted characters that converge on the frontier town of Chile Verde in search of buried gold. Soon the town is turned upside down as lust, greed, and passion are driven to a fever pitch. Divine plays Rosie Velez, a voluptuous barmaid who encounters Clint Eastwood-esque gunfighter, Abel Wood (played by veteran actor Tab Hunter) in the desert. The performances of the cast of seasoned comic actors make up for the shortcomings of the script in this silly but fun, raunchy romp through a very wild Old West. Cast also includes Geoffrey Lewis, Laine Kazan, Cesar Romero and Henry Silva.

results.title: Lumumba
results.creator_credit: JBA Productions, Entre Chien et Loup, Essential Filmproduktion, Velvet SA, Arte France, Jacques Bidou and Raoul Peck
results.brief_description: A political thriller that is the true story of a young African leader, elected at the age of 36 to become the first Prime Minister of the newly independent state of the Congo. Patrice Lumumba (Eriq Ebouaney) in the 1950s was fifty years before his time as he was seeking the ideal of a country free of colonial rule and a true democracy but he became a victim to corruption and powerful international big business interests. The film traces his journey from humble beginnings as a beer salesman to a voice of the people and great leader, finally to his torture and assassination. Powerfully acted and empathetically realised, this story resonates on two levels both as a personal life story of the man but also as an historical political account. Winner of a Peace Award at the Political Film Festival in the United States. A French, Belgian, German, Haitian co-production. Cast includes Alex Descas, Maka Kotto, Theophile Moussa Sowie, Andre Debaar.

results.title: Lucky Luciano
results.creator_credit: Harbor Productions, VIDES Cinematografica, Les Films de la Boetie, Franco Cristaldi and Francesco Rosi
results.brief_description: Inspired by real life events, ‘Lucky Luciano’ follows the infamous crime boss (Gian Maria Volonte) from the time he was pardoned after serving nine years of his 50-year sentence in the 1930s and 1940s, to his deportation to Italy. Once in Italy, Luciano is jailed for 10 years by narcotics investigator Charles Siragusa (playing himself in the film) who is trying to bring down a drug smuggling empire going from strength to strength. With ‘Lucky Luciano’ Rosi returns to his favourite theme, the connections between legal and illegal exercises of power (already present in films such as ‘Hands over the City’, also starring Rod Steiger). Rosi exposes the entanglement of the CIA and mob heroin-mongers during and in the years following World War II. Cast includes Edmund O’Brien, Charles Siragusa, Rod Steiger and Vincent Gardenia. The Italian-speaking actors are dubbed in English. Reference: San Francisco International Film Festival (1997). http://www.sfiff.org/festivals/1997/thefilms/html/bymaker_82.html

results.title: Love, honour and obey
results.creator_credit: BBC, Fugitive Features, Dominic Anciano and Ray Burdis
results.brief_description: Ray is the toughest gangster in North London, although he is preoccupied with thoughts of his upcoming marriage to Sadie and his favourite pastime, karaoke. Postman Jonny, bored with his job, wants to join Ray’s gang and enlists the help of his best friend, Jude, who also happens to be Ray’s nephew. Jude is unenthusiastic but sets up the meeting instead. Ray takes Jonny on, using his position as postman to steal credit cards. Jonny quickly becomes bored and, desperate for some real action, starts a feud between Ray’s gang and a tough South London gang. Cast includes Jonny Lee Miller, Jude Law, Ray Winstone, Sadie Frost and Rhys Ifans.

results.title: Love streams
results.creator_credit: Cannon Group, Menahem Golan, Yoram Globus and John Cassavetes
results.brief_description: In Cassavetes’ films the meaning behind love, relationships and identity cannot be easily apprehended because characters are always placed in the thick of things. “Love Streams” is about a brother and sister with different approaches to love, who come together to ease each other’s trouble. Robert Harmon doesn’t know how to establish lines of communication with his son, girlfriend and ex-wife. On the other hand, his sister, Sarah Lawson, repels her daughter and husband with her obsessive love. In an early scene Sarah states to the court that “love is a continuous stream”. The saying informs the rest of the director’s work, where the characters’ personal dilemmas perpetuate their own life.

results.title: Love story
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Howard G. Minsky and Arthur Hiller
results.brief_description: Eric Segal’s best-selling novel adapted for the silver screen, became one of the most famous and loved “tear jerkers” of cinema history. Starring Ali MacGraw and Ryan O’Neal, they play a young college couple, Jenny and Oliver. The story chronicles their love as they overcome the obstacles of different social status, their marriage and ultimate separation when death claims Jenny. Nominated for seven Academy Awards, the film co-stars Ray Milland and John Marley. The haunting theme song became a hit classic of the movies.

results.title: Love serenade
results.creator_credit: Saddleback Productions, AFFC, Jan Chapman and Shirley Barrett
results.brief_description: Two bored sisters Dimity and Vicki-Ann live in a small country town. Their new neighbour, a brooding self-centered radio personality arrives on the scene and threatens to turn their world upside down. Dimity and Vicki-Ann find themselves in competition for his affections as each develops a severe crush on the aging Lothario with a predilection for ‘70’s music and young women. Awarded the Camera D’Or at the 1996 Cannes Film Festival and starring Miranda Otto and Rebecca Frith (as the love-torn sisters) alongside George Shevtsov and John Alansu. Cinematography by Mandy Walker.
